citeinfo.title: 2002 (Jan. - Feb.) U.S. Bottom Trawl Survey Leg 2 Data for Arrowtooth Flounder on the Outter Continental Shelf and Upper Slope of the Gulf of Alaska West of Kodiak Island - R/V Miller Freeman (Cruise ID: MF2002-01)

abstract.p: The Alaska Fisheries Science Center FOCI program conducted a bottom trawl survey on the outer continental shelf and upper slope of the Gulf of Alaska west of Kodiak Island.

Bottom trawls were conducted to collect juvenile walleye pollock for otoliths and adult arrowtooth flounder for sexual maturity and spawning studies. Arrowtooth flounder data include lengths, otoliths, maturities, and gonads. Data (CTD) on physical characteristics of water in the area were also collected.

Other collected samples include Cholorophyll, nutrient, microzooplankton, sebastes, bathymasterid larvae, capelin rough count, and quantitative tows preserved in formalin. Zooplankton data and data on physical characteristics of the water column were also be collected.

Cruise ID: MF2002-01 (29 Jan. - 9 Feb. 2002)
Survey vessels: R/V Miller Freeman

descript.purpose: To conduct bottom trawl sampling on the outer continental shelf and upper slope in the Gulf of Alaska west of Kodiak Island in order to establish the apprearance of arrowtooth flounder eggs in the plankton.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
